alert.note: Alert for Middlesex; Monmouth (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 04 at 2:58PM EDT until July 04 at 4:30PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central New Jersey...and northern New Jersey... including the following counties...in central New Jersey... Monmouth. In northern New Jersey...Middlesex. * WHEN...Until 430 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 258 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly across portions of the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Old Bridge, East Brunswick, South Brunswick, Marlboro, Matawan, Jamesburg, Cranbury, Whittingham, Yorketown, Robertsville, Morganville, and Clearbrook Park. - This includes the following highways... New Jersey Turnpike near exit 9. Garden State Parkway between mile markers 117 and 119. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
